order.why: Identity first. Fixing party/org data resolves the highest-volume, easiest extraction errors and prevents downstream mismatches.
order.primary_outputs: Validated account + entity identifiers (legal name, type, formation, address).

order.why: Confirm who the people are (signatories/points of contact). Reduces ambiguity before interpreting contract terms.
order.primary_outputs: Validated contact identities (legal name, email) linked to Accounts.

order.why: Core deal classification + term/rights. This sheet is the hinge for most requiredness rules in the system.
order.primary_outputs: Deal family selection (type/subtype), territory, term, rights toggles, options/termination.

order.why: Schedule/Exhibit metadata can clarify record types or attachments that change how we interpret Catalog/Financials.
order.primary_outputs: Attachment classification (e.g., record type / schedule presence).

order.why: Defines what is being distributed (assets). This is needed to validate scope, counts, and ownership signals.
order.primary_outputs: Asset list (albums/tracks), IDs (ISRC/UPC/ISWC), dates, writer links.

order.why: Ownership splits at the composition/master level. Used to validate rights + financial logic and to catch mismatched ownership assumptions.
Only after classification + scope. Financial rows are highly dependent on deal type, rights, and add-ons.
order.primary_outputs: Payments/advances/fees/threshold structures linked to the deal.

order.why: Last: optional modules that branch off the core deal (matching, exclusivity add-ons, special fee constructs).
